page.title: 04Parkhurst Methodist chapel.
page.content: Two memorial stones were laid on "Coronation Day" June 28th. 1872 by Mrs.Dore of Newport and Mr. Benjamin Vibert. These can be seen in front of the chapel. The chapel was finished and opened on October 16th. 1872, the eventual cost of the venture Â£517. The schoolroom at the rear of the chapel was opened in 1890 and cost Â£205.Besides the childrens' Sunday School which is well attended there is a morning and an evening service except in the very cold winter months when just the morning services are held.The services are taken by local lay preachers.During the week the schoolroom is used by The Brownies, The Womens' Institute and the Womens' Fellowship.
